title: Greek-English (1896) Englishman's New Testament (Stephens and KJV)
title_vernacular: Η Καινή Διαθήκη του Englishman (1896, Stephens και KJV)
description:
The 1896 "Englishman's Greek New Testament" is a significant bilingual edition that presents the Greek text of the 1550 Stephens New Testament alongside the Authorized King James Version (KJV) of the Bible. This work bridges the gap between the original Greek text and one of the most influential English translations of the Bible.

The Greek text in this edition is based on the 1550 version by Robert Stephens, a renowned 16th-century printer and scholar. Stephens' Greek text played a pivotal role in biblical scholarship, particularly influencing the development and standardization of the Greek New Testament.

By presenting the Stephens text alongside the KJV, the "Englishman's Greek New Testament" provides a unique tool for comparative study. This parallel format allows readers and scholars to compare the original Greek with its translation in the KJV, offering insights into the translation process, textual variations, and the interpretation of biblical texts.

This edition serves not only as a valuable resource for students of biblical languages but also for those interested in the history of biblical translation. The combination of the influential Stephens Greek text with the equally significant KJV makes this work a critical resource for understanding the development and impact of biblical texts in both the original Greek and in English translation.
